title: How to Deter Flies Using Potpourri

steps.headline: Gather your supplies.
steps.description: You'll need dried orange peel, dried lemon peel, and cloves. The quantities are dependent on the amount you wish to make.

steps.headline: Mix the supplies together in a bowl.
steps.description: Sprinkle a little orris root over them as a fixative.

steps.headline: Place into a jar with a lid.
steps.description: Seal and leave to absorb the odors for 1 to 2 weeks. Shake every few days.

steps.headline: Remove the lid from the jar.
steps.description: Leave the jar to sit, lid off, where flies enter the home or tend to congregate. Flies detest the odor of citrus and will be encouraged to stay away.

steps.headline: Make enough.
steps.description: It's recommended to keep more than one jar of citrus potpourri in your home. Have two in the kitchen (one near the window), one at the front door, one at the back door, and one in the bathroom/toilet.

text: Gather your supplies. You'll need dried orange peel, dried lemon peel, and cloves. The quantities are dependent on the amount you wish to make. Mix the supplies together in a bowl. Sprinkle a little orris root over them as a fixative. Place into a jar with a lid. Seal and leave to absorb the odors for 1 to 2 weeks. Shake every few days. Remove the lid from the jar. Leave the jar to sit, lid off, where flies enter the home or tend to congregate. Flies detest the odor of citrus and will be encouraged to stay away. Make enough. It's recommended to keep more than one jar of citrus potpourri in your home. Have two in the kitchen (one near the window), one at the front door, one at the back door, and one in the bathroom/toilet.
